_header: O gracious Jesu both trusty and kind
Note: For a related work with the same refrain, cf. 6371.
Subjects: transitoriness, of world; mutability; scripture, paraphrases of; Christ, prayers to
_description: ‘Spes mea in deo est’, on the instability of the world and need to put one’s trust in God, perhaps based on Psalms 36:3—four cross-rhymed quatrains including refrain, ‘Spes mea in deo est’

Holkham755.First Lines:
O gracyous Ihesu bothe trysty and kyndeSpem meam to put in
                    the me thynketh best…
Holkham755.Last Lines:
…Yet y may nout faile me thynketh be reson>lb/>Yef y hope well
                        spes mea in deo est
